Posts.Content: Jan 7, 2009 11:15PM susan7 wrote: Dear Janice, I am so sorry you had to join our club.  I know how you feel ....I was diagnosed in May of 2006...missed my mammogram due to Hurricane Katrina...and bam no history, no lump, no symptoms  and was diagnosed stage three.   I have completed all my treatment now...surgery for the mastectomy, chemo and radiation.  You can get through anything!  just take it one day at a time.  Have faith, pray, and I promise in due time this journey will bless you in ways you never dreamed of.  I have now just gotten breast reconstructive surgery where they took my stomach fat and made me a breast.  I have one more surgery to go and believe me I was a chicken before all of this and now I feel so much stronger as a person.   Let family and friends support you and you too will be just fine!  Live strong as a mountain. S
Posts.Title: I am scared -just diagnosed jancie traceyz
